title.narrative: IR 2.1_OUT OF SCHOOL CHILDREN IDENTIFIED

description.narrative: By December 2016, 80% of municipalities from Semi-Arid, Amazon and of those with more than 150 thousand inhabitants strengthened capacity has increased to identify and locate girls and boys aged 4 to 17 who are out of school or in risk of dropping out, and to implement equity focused programmes to ensure the universalization of the right to quality education., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, each and every child aged 4 to 17 exercising their constitutional right to basic education municipalities and state public schools network achieved or surpassed quality official index (IDEB 2015) goals teachers and municipal education and school managers have their capacities developed for quality education basic education drop out and retention rates of most disadvantaged boys and girls decrease in the Amazon, Semiarid and in the 174 municipalities with more than 150 thousand inhabitants, especially among indigenous, quilombola, riparian, afro-Brazilians children and adolescents, those with disabilities, and also the most vulnerable to emergencies and disaster risks.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By December 2016, 80% of municipalities from Semi-Arid, Amazon and of those with more than 150 thousand inhabitants strengthenedcapacity has increased to identify and locate girls and boys aged 4 to 17 who are out of school or in risk of dropping out, and toimplement equity focused programmes to ensure the universalization of the right to quality education.

description.narrative: UNICEF and partners developed a strategy on active search of out of school children and adolescents inspiring municipalities to work through an intersectoral manner to address school exclusion. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: % of municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the SAB and Amazon regions and participating in the 8 Large Urban Centers trained with UNICEF's support, taking part in BPC Escola (Continuous Cash Benefit for Schools) system and developing actions to actively reach out disabled children and adolescents to include them in the school system.
